intro: Karatas innocentii, commonly known as the Persian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in temperate climates. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of its native range.
